title: Fast Student Copula Estimation in R [closed]
text:
I want to estimate the parameters of a Student Copula in R. My data is currently 5-dimensional, and approximately 5000 observations, but can be way larger.

The fitCopula function from the copula package is extremely slow to run on this case, and not acceptable if I need to run on larger data.

Is there either an alternative package that may be much faster in estimating parameters on large datasets, or shortcuts on estimating quickly the parameters ? For instance, the correlation matrix parameters seem to be very close from the empirical correlation matrix : could this be a suitable estimate ? How about the degrees of freedom ?

Please find below a reproducible example.

library(copula)

R <- matrix(c(
  1.0, 0.5, 0.3, 0.2,
  0.5, 1.0, 0.4, 0.3,
  0.3, 0.4, 1.0, 0.5,
  0.2, 0.3, 0.5, 1.0
), nrow=4, ncol=4)

# degrees of freedom
nu <- 5

# Create t-Copula object
t_cop <- tCopula(param = P2p(R), df = nu, dim = 4, dispstr = "un")

U <- rCopula(6000, t_cop)

fitCopula(tCopula(dim = 4, dispstr = "un", df.fixed = F), U)
